intro: Pseudoconnarus subtriplinervis, commonly known as the three-veined pseudoconnarus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinct three-veined pattern. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique leaf venation and potential ecological role in its native habitats.
